issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Modify the option of FsShell getmerge from [addnl] to [-nl] for consistency

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The docs at:

    http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/r2.7.1/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/FileSystemShell.html#getmerge

say that addnl is a valid parameter, but as of HADOOP-7348, it's been replaced with -nl.  The docs should be updated.

This message was automatically generated.

Minor nitpick, but it would be nice if the doc's usage string matched what the shell prints:

Usage: hadoop fs [generic options] -getmerge [-nl] <src> <localdst>

i.e. swap the -nl to be the first, not last, arg.
Thanks for your review [~templedf] ,please find the updated patch, review the same

[~jagadesh.kiran] thanks for updated patch..It's looks good me..+1 (non-binding)

Looks good to me. 

bq. Optionally -nl can be set to enable adding a newline character at the end of each file.
Would you document that the newline character is LF? Adding (LF) between 'character' and 'at the end' is fine to me.
Thanks [~ajisakaa]  for your review,Updated with Review comments ,please check
